data.event: Wellington was first surveyed in 1871 and named for the Duke of Wellington.

event.title: was designated as the permanent seat of Sumner County in 1872

data.event: It was designated as the permanent seat of Sumner County in 1872, winning out over competitor Sumner City.
The first post office in Wellington was established in July 1871.

event.title: 1887, the Chicago, Kansas and Nebraska Railway built

data.event: In 1887, the Chicago, Kansas and Nebraska Railway built a branch line north-south from Herington through Wellington to Caldwell.

It foreclosed in 1891 and was taken over by Chicago, Rock Island and Pacific Railway, which shut down in 1980 and reorganized as Oklahoma, Kansas and Texas Railroad, merged in 1988 with Missouri Pacific Railroad, merged in 1997 with Union Pacific Railroad.
